Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Enkelytin (one chain of Proenkephalin-A; mammals, animals)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the opioid neuropeptide precursor family
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Micrococcus luteus (MIC=0.2-0.4 µM), Bacillus megaterium (MIC=0.2-0.4 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Comments: No comments found on DRAMP database

Literature.Title: Partial characterization of the mRNA that codes for enkephalins in bovine adrenal medulla and human pheochromocytoma.
Literature.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 1982 Jan;79(2)360-364.
Literature.Author: Comb M, Herbert E, Crea R.

Literature.Title: The C-terminal bisphosphorylated proenkephalin-A-(209-237)-peptide from adrenal medullary chromaffin granules possesses antibacterial activity.
Literature.Author: Goumon Y, Strub JM, Moniatte M, Nullans G, Poteur L, Hubert P, Van Dorsselaer A, Aunis D, Metz-Boutigue MH.

Literature.Title: Cloning and sequence analysis of cDNA for bovine adrenal preproenkephalin.
Literature.Author: Hirose T.,Toyosato M.,Takahashi H.,Furutani Y.,Noda M.

Literature.Title: Molecular cloning establishes proenkephalin as precursor of enkephalin-containing peptides.
Literature.Author: Udenfriend S.,Gage L.P.,Hoffman B.J.,Seeburg P.,Gubler U.
